snippet: The captives were freed after protesters demonstrated against an impasse over a law on identification documents that had left babies unable to travel abroad or see a doctor.
abstract: About 1,500 lawmakers, government employees and foreign guests are freed after thousands of irate protesters form human chain around Bosnian Parliament building in Sarajevo for 14 hours to demonstrate against impasse over law on identification documents; previous law lapsed in February, leaving all babies born since then without identification documents necessary to travel abroad or see a doctor.
lead_paragraph: The captives were freed after protesters demonstrated against an impasse over a law on identification documents that had left babies unable to travel abroad or see a doctor.

headline.seo: Protest in Bosnia Over IDs Traps Hundreds in Parliament
headline.main: In Bosnia, a Protest Over IDs Traps Hundreds in Parliament
headline.print_headline: In Bosnia, a Protest Over IDs Traps Hundreds in Parliament
